When the acid dissociation constants of various acids in water at 25° C. are shown for reference, HCl (−3.7), HBr. (−4.1), HNO<sub>3 </sub>(−1.8), chloroacetic acid (2.9), benzoic acid (4.2), and phenol (9.9) (see, for example, Non-Patent Document 9).
For the polymerization initiator (C) of the present invention, it is preferable to use an aryliodonium salt that produces an acid by a cleavage reaction represented by Formula (1), the acid having an acid dissociation constant in water a 25° C. of −3.0 or higher, as the photoacid generator (C3). 
Furthermore, it is more preferable to use an aryliodonium salt that produces an acid by a cleavage reaction, the acid having an acid dissociation constant in water at 25° C. of −2.0 to 10.0.
